title: A Quality Existence - Channel Introduction
description:
Inspired by the work of Robert M. Pirsig in my worldview and daily life.
T-shirt: https://outofprint.com/products/zen-and-art-of-motorcycle-maintenance-womens-book-t-shirt
Blurb for the t-shirt: Pirsig's classic appears in the Guinness Book of Records as the bestselling book rejected by the largest number of publishers (121). From the 1974 first edition cover by Paul Bacon.

Some resources (will add here, so check back)

Cool Pirsig bio timeline: https://www.psybertron.org/timeline.html
Lots of resources, filmmaker Dennis Davis site: Pirsigsjourney.org
Dr. Gurr's site (fellow prof at Montana): http://venturearete.org/ResearchProjects/ProfessorGurr/Main/HomePage
Dr. Ant McWatt (popular version of his dissertation): https://cdn.website-editor.net/90e0cb600d8146f9af85b88f0c2f8fb2/files/uploaded/MOQ%2520Textbook%2520%2528Nov%25202010%2529%2520pp%2520.pdf
Masters theses:
https://www.robertpirsig.org/wp-content/uploads/2020/11/SneddonThesisMaster.pdf
http://digital.auraria.edu/AA00004912/00001
Vestiges of a once vibrant space, still many good resources: originalMOQ.org
Guidebook: https://www.amazon.com/Ronald-Disanto-Motorcycle-Maintenance-Revolution/dp/B01FOD7EIS/ref=sr_1_2?crid=HLWEN328QLG7&dchild=1&keywords=guidebook+to+zen+and+the+art+of+motorcycle+maintenance&qid=1619181923&sprefix=guidebook+to+zen+an%2Caps%2C153&sr=8-2



Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/A_Quality_Existence

Bitcoin: 3CgWApeyrGsteeDybrGUau98bX5MSdHvN8

NEW substack: https://aqualityexistence.substack.com/

NEW Twitter: AQualityexiste1 (I just came back, so I lost all my followers. Please join me)

transcript_parts.text: [Music]
hi there
welcome to my channel equality existence
i started this channel as a way to
engage with the youtube community to
help me understand the work of robert
impersic
and to share and give voice to my
journey to do so
primarily i use these two books excuse
their condition
the two and only novels that perseg
wrote
but occasionally i will use additional
per sig writings and other people's
interpretations for example there is a
guidebook to zen in the art of
motorcycle maintenance
and there is both a doctoral
dissertation and at least one master's
thesis on persic's work among numerous
other resources
some extensive i will link to some of
these below
this one zen in the art of motorcycle
maintenance was published in 1974.
many people know about this book and
many of you have read it it's an
incredible journey topographically
psychologically and metaphysically which
ultimately reconciles
classic and romantic art and science and
father and son
as it establishes a philosophy of
reality based on quality
on value rather than on subjects and
objects
materialism it illustrates more with
real-life examples and edifying talks
unaffectedly
referred to as chautauqua's rather than
philosophical lectures
this one lila was published in 1991
it is much lesser known and certainly
didn't have the appeal of zen in the art
of motorcycle maintenance
for example the characters in the
journey itself are much less pleasant
but it goes into great depth into
persic's philosophy and is essentially
his treatise
for this reason lila has a bigger
following among serious philosophy
students and aficionados
lila is much more straightforward and in
a radio interview with bbc
persig says it was written because he
was frustrated
with the inability of his readers to
fully understand his philosophy
he felt like he needed to clarify what
he was trying to say and in doing so he
expanded his metaphysics which he names
in this book
the metaphysics of quality significantly
lilac codifies this metaphysics of
quality expands the nature of quality
and adds a moral and evolutionary
element that completes the project
while some people prefer one over the
other i encourage reading both
in the first we follow the process of
the development of the metaphysics of
quality and this is important i think
because the process-oriented narrative
helps us make that
visceral shift of understanding gives us
a set of lenses if you will
and by virtue of this new set of
spectacles we are prepared to refine our
understanding
through lila so a little bit about my
relationship with this amazing work and
the point of this channel
i discovered in persic an understanding
of reality that completely blew my mind
when i finally felt like i understood
what he was saying i experienced a
metaphysical paradigm shift
that led me to want to pursue not just a
deeper understanding
but to also attempt to try to
see the world through this philosophy
and potentially live through it
a large part of my work on this channel
is commenting on the two books
i have a complete chapter by chapter
commentary on zen in the art of
motorcycle maintenance
these commentaries are rather dated at
this point and in many cases don't
exhibit
my more complete understanding of
persic's work so take them with a little
bit of a grain of salt
i should probably redo them at some
point but they're not bad
presently i've moved on to reading and
commenting on
his second book lila an inquiry into
morals
in addition to these videos i've plenty
of commentary
on a variety of topics and on other
youtube videos in my community and
discussions
with participants other youtubers in
this community
and it was this that i was seeking this
this group of people in which i can
exchange
ideas and further develop my
understanding
and it has been invaluable in helping me
both expand my understanding of his work
and how it can relate to other people's
world views and how their world views
can help inform me
through the piercing lens in both cases
i encourage you to read the comments
below these videos as many viewers have
much more sophisticated takes on these
matters
and on persic's work than i do i need to
tell you of course
i mean i think it's obvious at this
point i'm not an expert i'm not a
scholar
and i haven't studied much philosophy
i'm a lay person who with some struggle
and clumsiness and slowly integrating
the metaphysics of quality
to help me live in a better way to have
a quality existence
i'm also expanding my deep understanding
of persic on my own terms and this may
rattle people who believe there is one
right way to interpret persic's work
i get that this also may rattle people
who project onto percy
a particular political viewpoint it is
my contention
that a genius of this magnitude was
beyond politics
unfortunately i find it necessary to say
this since
everything is politics these days i'm
also engaging
with what strikes my fancy personally
and attempt to the best of my ability to
do this again through the lens of person
quality and the metaphysics equality i
pursue many avenues here besides purse
again again i don't claim to have
purchase on any persian
interpretation but i'm about as big a
fan
as you will find so i hope that makes
sense and i hope you will visit again
